meanings.definition: A book size resulting from folding a sheet of paper into eight leaves.
meanings.sent1: The librarian handed me an octavo to read during my break.
meanings.sent2: I found a beautiful octavo edition of my favorite novel at the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally tore an octavo page while trying to turn it quickly.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an octavo of thoughts, neatly folded and organized.
meanings.sent5: The octavo size made the book easy to carry in my bag.

meanings.definition: A book composed of octavo pages.
meanings.sent1: The author's latest work was printed as an octavo for easy distribution.
meanings.sent2: I prefer reading octavos because they are more compact than larger books.
meanings.sent3: The octavo pages fluttered in the wind like colorful butterflies.
meanings.sent4: His ideas were neatly arranged in the octavo, making it a joy to read.
meanings.sent5: The octavo format allowed the book to fit perfectly on the shelf.
